New Records: Shubman Gill scored 92 runs, Virat Kohli scored 88 runs, Shreyas Iyer scored 82 runs, Ravindra Jadeja scored 35 runs, and Mohammed Shami took 5 wickets with a new record (45 wickets in the World Cup), India set the highest score of 357/8, Sri Lanka scored the lowest ODI score of 55 in 19.4 overs
Key Match Events: India's dominant performance with a 302-run win, Virat Kohli's 88-run knock, Shubman Gill's 92-run innings, Shreyas Iyer's 82-run contribution, Ravindra Jadeja's run-out, Mohammed Shami's record-breaking wickets, Sri Lanka's poor start and collapse
Pre-Game Insights: India were put into bat and Rohit Sharma was dismissed early, Shubman Gill and Virat Kohli took control of the innings, Sri Lanka's bowlers performed poorly in powerplay
Post-Match Reflections: India's players expressed confidence and pride in their performance, Sri Lanka's captain Angelo Mathews was dismissed cheaply, the match outcome significantly impacted the World Cup standings
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at Wankhede Stadium, India's victory all but eliminated Sri Lanka from the World Cup, India's unbeaten record in the World Cup
